name: Somers Bay Log Cabin Lodging

reviews.text: Our party of six reserved 3 cabins for our last 2 nights in this area. We had spent the previous 5 days in Glacier National Park and wanted to end our trip in the Flathead region. I found Somers Bay Log Cabins online and truly didn’t know what to expect. This place is a gem, and I very much hope to return soon.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reservations were easy. Tom and Jane require a deposit, which we paid with personal checks. I was concerned that we wanted a Thursday/Friday stay on the weekend of July 4th. This wasn’t a problem at all.
reviews.title: Great Cabins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kitchenettes are stocked with everything needed—glassware, dishes, utensils, adequate pots/pans, dish soap, dish cloth and towel, coffee maker, coffee, salt, pepper, sweeteners. We drove 7 – 9 miles to a lovely grocery store in Kalispell to buy what we’d need for the 2 ½ days. We thoroughly enjoyed the small gas grill on the porch.
reviews.title: A beautiful, hidden gem you will want to visit over and over!

description: Seven authentic cozy log cabins on the Northwest tip of Flathead Lake. Within walking distance of restaurants and Somers State Park swinmming beach, picnic area and boat launch. A short drive to Glacier National park, National Bison Range, Golfing, Sking and many more activities. Cabin amenities include Kitchenettes, air conditioning, TV-DVD, WIFI, Phones, covered porch with gas bbq and plenty of parking for your boat.
